availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Paul W. Terrell (Ballard County, Kentucky, soldier and farmer.)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, soldier and farmer. Caroline County, Virginia, native. Farmer in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1847. Served in the U.S.-Mexican War from April 14, 1847, to December 5, 1847. Farmer in Ballard County in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1850. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Ballard County in 1860. Farmer in Ballard County in 1863.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Tharps District, p. 44B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Ballard County, KY, June 1863, p. 43.
US, Registers of Enlistments in the United States Army, 1798-1914, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M233, Roll 23, p. 247.
